Class AlarmClock

  • java.lang.Object
    • AlarmClock

  • public class AlarmClock
extends java.lang.Object
    AlarmClock class simulates a real world clock that displays the current time and can also set an alarm
    Version:
    2019.01.12
    Author:
    Micheal Kolling and David J. Barnes and Agina Oghenemena Benaiah

    • Constructor Detail

      • AlarmClock

        public AlarmClock()
        Default constructor that creates an object of type clockDisplay12 and Alarm object

      • AlarmClock

        public AlarmClock(int hoursClock,
                  int minutesClock,
                  java.lang.String timeClock,
                  int hoursAlarm,
                  int minutesAlarm,
                  java.lang.String timeAlarm,
                  boolean setAlarm)
        Constructor that takes the number of hours, minutes and specifies a.m. or p.m. for the clock and the alarm. It creates an object for the current time and the alarm
        Parameters:
        hoursClock - stores the hours entered by the user
        minutesClock - stores the minutes entered by the user
        timeClock - stores a.m. or p.m. entered by the user
        hoursAlarm - stores the hours entered by the user
        minutesAlarm - stores the minutes entered by the user
        alarmTime - stores a.m. or p.m. entered by the user
        setAlarm - to true or false. True means it is set. false means it's not set

    • Method Detail

      • clockTick

        public void clockTick()
        Increments the minute and checks the time current clock time is thesame as the alarm set time. if they are thesame, it prints out a message and turns the alarm off.

        public java.lang.String getAlarmTime()

        Returns:

        minutes - stores the number of minutes entered by the user
        time - sets the Alarm time time to a.m. or p.m.
